STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 19, 2024
James Allan Perlaki
Traverse Place
512 S Grand Traverse St,
Flint, MI, 48502-1207
RE: License#: CB250201474
Dear Mr. Perlaki:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on Spetemeber 6, 2024 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance
with applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be
receiving the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is
nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge- Pifer at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
R400.12509(3)(o) Independent living record.
• The agency is apprised to be mindful of its reporting period dates, so that they
don’t inaccurately list the reporting period or go over the 90 days requirement
for completion.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Nothing this inspection.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, That corrective action plan related to the agency’s Interim
inspection where it received two rules violations. The agency's corrective action
plan which indicated it would create a spreadsheet related to service plan due
dates, and after discharge youth follow ups was implemented and completed. Its
tracking methods of sending workers email and calendar reminders related to
these tasks, and an initial meeting with staff in November 2023 was also
implemented and completed. A review of the spreadsheet, and proof of all other
reported actions were seen onsite on 9/6/2024. The results of all these actions
were also illustrated during this inspection review. The agency received no rule
violations this inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency submitted a chief administrator's report dated 9/3/2024. The agency
reported it has worked diligently with its case managers on its Interim Corrective
Action Plan. That it has worked closely with case managers on the timeliness of
service plans, and 90 day and 180 day follow ups on youths after discharge. The
agency reported success in both of these areas; and the results of this year's
inspection demonstrated that success.
Financial Overview
The agency provided a copy of a 2024 annual budget and 9/30/2023 independent
financial audit. A review of these documents did not show areas of concern.
Staff and Youth Interviews
In addition to my discussion with the chief administrator and program coordinator, I
interviewed two case managers. All staff reported the agency is continuing to
provide active services to youths and to see favorable outcomes. The two case
managers reported feeling the chief administrator and program manager are doing
a good job. Additionally, they felt supported by these administrators and their co-
workers. They believed the program empowers youths to achieve and aids them in
obtaining life skills, as well as personal identification documents. Areas for growth
reported were for continued improved communication between staff to staff and
staff to youth, with focus on ensuring what is written down is passed on to all.
Also, for all staff to hold youths accountable for their actions initially and
consistently.
Although youth interviews are not required, it was an expectation by the agency,
and two youths were interviewed. Both youths reported positives about the
program and the staff. The one area of growth reported was for the house's
environment to be updated.

Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the facility did not reveal any safety concerns. The agency has
sufficient space and equipment for its staff; and files were securely stored.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable. This is not a contracted agency.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
September 9, 2024
_____________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
